FacilityName: Peter Pan Seafoods - Port Moller, AK

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This Risk Management Plan (RMP) is submitted to the United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) to meet the requirements of Section 112(r) of the Clean Air Act Amendments of 1990, codified in Title 40, Part 68 of the Code of Federal Regulations.



Stationary Source and Chemical of Concern

Peter Pan Seafoods, Inc. Port Moller facility is located in Port Moller, Alaska. The facility is a remote salmon processing plant which operates annually May through September. The facility processes sockeye (red) salmon but also produces small amounts of king, coho, and chum salmon. The facility processes and stores frozen seafood using anhydrous ammonia as a refrigerant in a closed-loop system. Ammonia is the safest refrigerant available and has excellent warning properties; it is extremely pungent at levels far below dangerous concentrations. The ammonia refrigeration was completely rebuilt in 2018/2019.



Accidental Release Prevention Program 

The Peter Pan Seafoods, Inc. Port Moller facility implements a prevention program to comply with the requirements of the Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR 1910.119), which is designed to prevent accidental releases of certain chemicals held in quantities over given thresholds.  The PSM program addresses all required elements including employee participation, process safety information and system drawings, operating procedures, hot work permits, management of change, mechanical integrity, training, pre-startup review, compliance audits, process hazard analysis, contractor safety, incident investigation and emergency response.  The system has many built-in safety features including high-level controls and indicators, pressure relief valves, automatic and manually controlled valves and shutoffs, and leak detectors.



Five Year Accident History

Per the requirements of 40 CFR 68.42, facilities must include a five-year accident history for all accidental releases from covered processes that resulted in deaths, injur

ies, or significant property damage on-site or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.  There have been no such accidents at this facility.



Emergency Response

The Peter Pan Seafoods, Inc. Port Moller facility maintains a written emergency response plan per 29 CFR 1910.120 to facilitate safe response to potentially uncontrolled ammonia releases.  The plan identifies personnel designated and trained to conduct the necessary duties during an emergency.  Responsibilities include notification of and communication with local responders and authorities, orderly evacuation of the facility and coordinating and conducting responses, as well as maintenance of emergency equipment and trained personnel. 



Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Safety at the facility is improved continuously through the process hazard analysis process, safety meetings, employee suggestions, accident, incident and near-miss investigations, and as the result of internal and external audits and inspections. Upgrades are planned on an ongoing basis as needed to keep the system in safe working order.
